extendedIngredients.name: flat leaf parsley
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup loosely packed flat leaf parsley, coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5-7 cloves of garlic, peeled and coarsely minced

extendedIngredients.name: salmon
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ pound cooked wild King salmon, skin and pin bones removed

extendedIngredients.name: shirataki spaghetti
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bag Shirataki Spaghetti, prepared according to bag instructions

recipes.title: Wild Salmon Pasta

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Casa Catelli Pinot Grigio. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 8 dollars.

productMatches.title: Casa Catelli Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: It has a straw yellow color. On the nose it has floral notes with hint of dry hay and fresh lemon. On the palate it has a soft citrus flavor with hints of crusty bread and acacia honey. Indeed, well balanced and pleasant to drink with and without food.

recipes.instructions: Heat a large sauté pan over medium heat. When hot, add the olive oil, followed by onion and garlic. Cook onion and garlic, stirring frequently, until soft and translucent, not brown, about 5 minutes. If they are browning, turn the heat down. When softened, add lemon juice and zest. Cook for a couple minutes, until the juices have reduced and thickened. Add noodles and salmon. Cook until warmed through, about 2-3 more minutes. Add parsley, and cook for 1minute more. Make sure the ingredients are evenly distributed, serve, and enjoy. A piece of bread, perhaps even homemade Italian, is the perfect compliment.

steps.step: Heat a large sauté pan over medium heat. When hot, add the olive oil, followed by onion and garlic. Cook onion and garlic, stirring frequently, until soft and translucent, not brown, about 5 minutes. If they are browning, turn the heat down. When softened, add lemon juice and zest. Cook for a couple minutes, until the juices have reduced and thickened.
Add noodles and salmon. Cook until warmed through, about 2-3 more minutes.
Add parsley, and cook for 1minute more. Make sure the ingredients are evenly distributed, serve, and enjoy. A piece of bread, perhaps even homemade Italian, is the perfect compliment.
